ACT
91
Method of calculation of gifts and legacies
The calculation is carried out in such a way that the other heirs receive the appropriate value from the estate, and only after that the rest of the estate is divided among all the heirs.
If the things and rights that the testator had in his property at the time of death are not sufficient for the other heirs to receive the appropriate value, the heir to whom it is credited is not obliged to return to them some of what he received.
Provisions on the necessary part apply to the calculation.
